div.p: v2 Description: The Observation Request (OBR) segment is used to transmit information specific to an order for a diagnostic study or observation, physical exam, or assessment.

p.span: FHIR Description (ServiceRequest): A record of a request for service such as diagnostic investigations, treatments, or operations to be performed.

Because OBR is part of both an order (OML) and a result (ORU) message, the segment may map to either ServiceRequest and/or DiagnosticReport. It can also contribute to a Specimen resource. It also has some overlap with the ORC and SPM segments.

tr.td:
ONLY USED WITH SPECIMEN
ServiceRequest.specimen(Specimen.collection.collected[x]) OR [depending on sequence of specimen collection visa vis service request]
Specimen.collection.collected[x] where Specimen.request(ServiceRequest) references the appropriate ServiceRequest

ONLY USED WITH SPECIMEN
ServiceRequest.specimen(Specimen.collection.collectedPeriod.end) OR [depending on sequence of specimen collection visa vis service request]
Specimen.collection.collectedPeriod.end where Specimen.request(ServiceRequest) references the appropriate ServiceRequest
Considering purpose of OBR-8, need to further refine boundaries of what is put into collectionPeriod.end, e.g., creatanine clearance.

ServiceRequest.specimen(Specimen.collection.quantity) OR [depending on sequence of specimen collection visa vis service request]
Specimen.collection.quantity where Specimen.request(ServiceRequest) references the appropriate ServiceRequest

Clarify the choice depends on whether the specimen is collected first and then a service request is made OR service request is made and then the specimen is collected. Both are valid. Note that an instance of ServiceRequest and Specimen can only ever point in one direction.
If OBR-11 = "P" then that can be used to determine whether to start with ServiceRequest or create a Specimen first.

Specimen.collection.collector(PractitionerRole) OR [depending on sequence of specimen collection visa vis service request]
ServiceRequest.specimen(Specimen.collection.collector(PractitionerRole))

Clarify the choice depends on whether the specimen is collected first and then a service request is made OR service request is made and then the specimen is collected. Both are valid. Note that an instance of ServiceRequest and Specimen can only ever point in one direction.
If OBR-11 = "P" then that can be used to determine whether to start with ServiceRequest or create a Specimen first.

ServiceRequest.intent (e.g., G=>reflex)
ServiceRequest.status (e.g., R=>new instance and ServiceRequest.replaces references prior version)
etc.
Would be defined as part of an implementation guide.

Specimen.receivedTime OR [depending on sequence of specimen collection visa vis service request]
ServiceRequest.specimen(Specimen.receivedTime)

Specimen.collection.bodySite OR [depending on sequence of specimen collection visa vis service request]
ServiceRequest.specimen(Specimen.colleciton.bodySite)
Needs to be decomposed before we can proceed.
Extension? Provenance? PractitionerRole.telecom? Other? Zulip thread. Hans to create
Is there any real need to have different note types for Placer Field 1 and 2?
Is there any real need to have different note types for FillerField 1 and 2?
n/a for a Service Request but presumably there will be a separate mapping for a DiagnosticReport resource if a result is included in the message
